items.title: Leading Australian rabbi implores Israeli government to tone down its rhetoric over Bondi terror attack
items.summary: Rabbi Benjamin Elton, the spiritual leader of the oldest synagogue in Sydney, told a Knesset committee that he would encourage Israeli leaders to 'have confidence in the Jewish institutions in Australia, to listen to their analyses, and listen to their advice'

items.title: Israeli Prison Service warns of rising risk from Palestinian prisoners left out of Hamas deal
items.summary: 'We are facing a situation in the prisons,' the prison chief said during a Knesset committee hearing. Without specifying the possible scenarios that could arise, he added that many prisoners now held in Israeli facilities are 'terrorists with proven operational capabilities'

items.title: From Jerusalem to D.C., the rise of Qatar is a grim marker of the death of democracy
items.summary: The U.S. bipartisan celebration of the hyper-capitalist hereditary monarchies of the Gulf states – symbolized most prominently by the rise of Qatar – signals a future in which the Gulf model goes global

items.title: 'War is not over': Detailed diagrams of prisons found in cells of Oct. 7 terrorists - report
items.summary: The diagrams included the locations of locks and the number of guards assigned to each wing, according to Ynet.

items.title: U.K. police charge two men with belonging to Hezbollah, attending terrorism training
items.summary: One of the men was an 'an entrenched member of Hezbollah' who trained in taking hostages and the other had access to a 'wide-ranging Hezbollah network' which was linked to facilitating the acquisition of drone parts

items.title: IDF drops case against officer who okayed researcher's Lebanon visit where soldier was killed
items.summary: Col. (res.) Yoav Yarom allowed Zeev Erlich, a historian and archaeologist, to visit an ancient mosque and fortress in Lebanon in violation of regulations. Sgt. Gur Kehati and Erlich were killed by Lebanese militants during the visit

items.title: Suspects in assault on Arab family in Jaffa identified as settler extremists, police say attack was racially motivated
items.summary: Police told the court that the three suspects had planned the attack and carried it out in a racially motivated assault. The attack sent shockwaves across Jaffa, with many businesses going on strike in protest and dozens of residents demonstrating

items.title: Gazans say the position of the Yellow Line changes, funneling them into a tightening area
items.summary: Gazans claim the Israeli-controlled area, marked by the so-called Yellow Line, changes without warning, moving west. 'We are not fighters,' says one mother sheltering in central Gaza, who worries her children will get caught in the line of fire, 'we are people trying to live'

items.title: Israel resurrects plan for 9,000-unit ultra-Orthodox neighborhood in Jerusalem, beyond internationally recognized 1948 border
items.summary: Critics warn the Atarot neighborhood, the first construction beyond Israel's internationally recognized Jerusalem border since the 1990s, could entrench Israeli control in East Jerusalem and block a future Palestinian state

items.title: Israel Diaspora Minister Chikli in Bondi Beach visit: Australia 'took zero action to fight antisemitism'
items.summary: The minister stopped short of blaming the Bondi Beach terror attack on the Australian government, but said 'but nothing was done. The government here contributed to a harsh anti-Israeli atmosphere.' He is scheduled to attend victims' funerals and speak to the local Jewish community

items.title: 'Remember her name': Sydney mourns 10-year-old Matilda, youngest victim of Bondi terror attack
items.summary: A GoFundMe campaign has been launched for the family, in honor of the 'bright, joyful, and spirited child who brought light to everyone around her.' It has already raised over $400,000, well over the $18,600 goal

items.title: Prisoners, gold seekers, and refugees from Nazis: the story of Jews and Australia since 1788
items.summary: From convicts and hopeful immigrants to a failed bid for Jewish autonomy – the long history of a community now going through one of its darkest moments

items.title: Opinion | It isn't fair or rational. But the Bondi massacre is a reminder that Jews will always be targets
items.summary: Efforts to contextualize or rationalize the devastating antisemitic violence in Australia are futile so long as irrational hatreds exist. Eternal vigilance will always be the price of Jewish life – in Israel and the Diaspora

items.title: In Photos: Bondi, the beach that lost its innocence
items.summary: Photos taken from the famed Australian beach before the terror attack, take on a new meaning after the horrific violence against the Jewish community

items.title: After the Bondi terror attack, the erasure of its Jewish victims
items.summary: Post after post, story after story, Australia's so-called progressive camp is 'all lives mattering' the Jewish community in Sydney: The same camp that mainstreamed anti-Jewish hostility is now diluting Jewish victimhood

items.title: New dashcam video reportedly shows couple tried to disarm Sydney attacker before being killed
items.summary: The couple, identified by The Sydney Morning Herald as Boris and Sofia Gurman, were the first two victims of Sunday's attack at a Chabad event at the famous Bondi Beach

items.title: Israel's justice minister asks top court to reconsider nominee for Sde Teiman abuse leak inquiry after judges block appointment
items.summary: The High Court of Justice rejected Levin's candidate to head the investigation in November, saying he did not meet the conditions the court had set, with one judge saying 'the fear arises that that person will serve as the minister's emissary'

items.title: From 'Spinal Tap' to 'When Harry Met Sally': Rob Reiner peaked early but never faded away
items.summary: Rob Reiner – whose shocking death alongside his wife Michelle at their L.A. home was reported on Monday - was a true mensch and a master of numerous genres. Does it matter that his most beloved works were all made in the first decade of his filmmaking career?

items.title: Hapoel Tel Aviv supporters threaten top court petition over police ban on protest shirts
items.summary: Police barred fans from entering recent matches wearing shirts critical of the police, the ultra-nationalist Kach movement and rival soccer club Maccabi Tel Aviv; supporters say the move violates freedom of expression

items.title: Jewish donors help raise $1.3M for Ahmed al Ahmed, who disarmed a Bondi Beach attacker
items.summary: Jewish hedge fund billionaire Bill Ackman donated $66,500 to a GoFundMe page for al Ahmed, who was recorded on Sunday crouching behind a car before jumping into action as one of the terrorists shot a firearm at the Jewish celebration at Sydney's Bondi Beach

items.title: Trump sues the BBC for defamation over editing of January 6 speech, seeks up to $10 billion in damages
items.summary: The lawsuit comes amid broader scrutiny of the BBC's editorial standards, including criticism of its Gaza documentaries

items.title: Mass shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach inspired by Islamic State, Australian police say
items.summary: A Tuesday news conference by state officials marked the first official confirmation of the suspects' suspected ideologies, with the Australian PM revealing that evidence from the scene included Islamic State flags. The New South Wales Police chief suggested a possible link between them and Muslim mi

items.title: Two years after Gaza paramedic's death at Sde Teiman, Israel has yet to provide answers to his family
items.summary: The paramedic died in Israeli military custody the same day he was detained during a coordinated medical evacuation in northern Gaza. His family learned of his death only after petitioning the court, and the autopsy results remain undisclosed

items.title: Lebanon is flexing its muscles with Iran - but war with Israel could play into Tehran's hands
items.summary: Beirut needs international support to curb Iranian efforts to maintain its presence in Lebanon while it continues to support Hezbollah. The resumption of war would free Tehran from this dilemma, as it fears the complete crushing of its regional sphere of influence

items.title: U.K. police charge two suspected Hezbollah members with terrorism training
New York City councilor slammed for call to expel Muslims in the wake of Bondi attack
items.summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani slammed the 'vile Islamophobia' after Republican council member Vickie Paladino wrote on X that 'we need to take very seriously the need to begin the expulsion of Muslims from Western nations'

items.title: Israel extends administrative detention of Palestinian rights activist for five more months
items.summary: Ayman Ghrayeb, who documents the forcible displacement of Jordan Valley communities, has been in 'administrative detention,' custody without trial, since November 17. On Monday his custody was extended by five months. Friends say that before his arrest, two Shin Bet agents told him they were fed up

items.title: Report: Top Trump officials 'very frustrated' with Netanyahu amid Gaza cease-fire violation
items.summary: A U.S. official told Axios, 'Netanyahu has turned over the last two years into a global pariah. He should ask himself why Egypt's al-Sisi refuses to meet him and why, five years after the Abraham Accords, he still hasn't been invited to visit the UAE'

items.title: Netanyahu's government wants a commission of whitewashing into October 7
Netanyahu's pardon plea isn't for the trial, but to absolve him from responsibility for Oct. 7
items.summary: Netanyahu knew full well when he submitted his request that it had no merit, but he judged it would spark a public debate in which even opponents of the pardon would treat it as a legitimate request. He judged correctly

items.title: Jerusalem fans wave Jewish supremacist Kahane flag; Tel Aviv fans' anti-Ben-Gvir shirts seized
items.summary: Beitar Jerusalem fans waved the flag of the late Rabbi Meir Kahane's far-right Kach movement at a match against an Arab-Israeli team on Monday. A day earlier, a security official confiscated a shirt reading 'FCK BNGVR,' a reference to far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, from Hapoel

items.title: IDF assesses Hezbollah's capabilities as Lebanese Army struggles to seize remaining arms
items.summary: The IDF says the Lebanese Army struggles to target Hezbollah's weapons stockpiles and operations in Shiite areas, while the group lacks the capability to carry out large-scale attacks on Israel. Hamas is also active, attempting to establish itself in Lebanon

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
ICC rejects Israeli bid to halt Gaza war probe; Netanyahu's arrest warrant remains
items.summary: Israel's Foreign Ministry condemned the International Criminal Court, calling the decision 'politics in the guise of international law'

items.title: Swiped Out: Dating-app burnouts turn to an ancient art for love
items.summary: Fed up with frustrating dating apps, many Jewish Americans are turning – like in the old shtetl – to matchmakers. Will the practice make Aliyah for secular Israelis?

items.title: From Belgrade to Miami: Israel to open five economic missions in Netanyahu-allied countries
items.summary: The locations chosen reflect not only Israel's economic opportunities but also its diplomatic standing with countries that maintained their support during the Gaza war

items.title: How American Jews are about to feel the effects of the horrific Bondi Hanukkah attack
items.summary: The attack in Sydney does not defy the imagination of Jewish Americans, already living in a country where their security is uncertain and rising antisemitism has been extraordinarily central in the American political conversation

items.title: A terrible line has been crossed. Australia has become a place of mass killing of Jews
items.summary: Will murderous antisemitism now be normalized in Australia, just as attacks on synagogues and antisemitic graffiti on our schools and threats of violence against 'Zionists' have been normalized?

items.title: 22 arrested in Amsterdam at protest outside Hanukkah concert featuring IDF chief cantor
items.summary: Amsterdam's Royal Concert Hall faced criticism last month after canceling a planned Hanukkah performance featuring cantor Shai Abramson. Following an uproar, organizers agreed to hold a public Hanukkah concert without him, alongside smaller private performances featuring Abramson earlier in the day

items.title: Israel's outlook for its Arab citizens in the year ahead: fewer prospects, more suspicion
items.summary: The Israeli government cuts $68 million from Arab social programs to fund security forces, while arrests, racist attacks, and political delegitimization signal a shrinking space for equality and civic life

items.title: Israel Police arrest two suspects in assault on Arab family in Jaffa; nationalist motive investigated
items.summary: The Shin Bet domestic intelligence agency is involved in the investigation. A court ordered the release of all 14 people arrested for participating in a rally protesting the assault, which included a pepper spray attack, while several schools and businesses went on strike in solidarity with the fami

items.title: Turkey excluded from U.S. military postwar Gaza summit in Doha as officials cite Israeli veto
items.summary: Representatives from more than 45 countries have been invited to participate in what is described as an 'interim meeting,' where no final decisions are slated to take place. An Arab source close to the Turkish government said that Doha and Ankara are currently exerting pressure on Washington to invi

items.title: From Bondi to Mumbai: How Chabad has been targeted in antisemitic attacks around the world
items.summary: The terror attack at Bondi Beach on Sunday was not the first directed at the Chabad Lubavitch movement and its institutions. As the movement has expanded its reach, it has also enhanced its exposure to attacks

items.title: Netanyahu's trial hearing cut short as Paraguayan parliament president visits court
items.summary: At the start of the hearing, Netanyahu said he had requested a full cancellation, citing 'something big in South America.' Before adjourning, he asked to shorten the session by an hour to prepare for a meeting with Trump's special envoy to Syria

items.title: As storms flood Gaza's tent camps, Israeli NGOs race to raise money and aid
items.summary: As conditions in Gaza worsen for those displaced by the war, two Israeli NGOs are stepping up their aid efforts. 'We need to help others for only one reason: because we can, and because they need help,' says a director of one organization

items.title: U.S. says it foils 'massive' New Year's Eve bombing plot in California by pro-Palestinian group
items.summary: Federal authorities said four alleged members of an extremist group suspected of planning coordinated bombing attacks on New Year's Eve across Southern California were arrested

items.title: Sydney gunman in Hanukkah attack reportedly linked to Islamic State
items.summary: One of the Sydney Hanukkah shooters was reportedly investigated six years ago for Islamic State ties but was deemed no longer a threat. Investigators say both gunmen, who killed 15 people on Sunday, pledged allegiance to ISIS

items.title: New Israeli Fiction | To Mourn It
items.summary: A short story by Lilach Volach

items.title: 'It's horrific. We begged our government to prevent this': Australian Jews are angry after the Bondi terror attack
Profiting From Exploitation: How We Found the Man Behind Two Deepfake Porn Sites
items.summary: Content warning: This article contains descriptions of non-consensual sexual imagery. Depending on which of his social media profiles you were looking at, Mark Resan was either a marketing lead at Google or working for a dental implant company, a human resources company and a business software firm

items.title: Israel Police release Jewish men who assaulted Arabs in Tel Aviv from house arrest
items.summary: Mahmoud Agbariya from northern Israel's Umm al-Fahm has been hospitalized for over a week. His father told Haaretz that the two assailants, identified as cops, asked him questions and beat him before he had a chance to answer'

items.title: Israel to redirect $68 million from Arab social programs to Shin Bet, police
items.summary: The funds, approved despite legal warnings, will boost the Shin Bet's role in non-security crime and expand police units, as far-right ministers push a controversial shift from social support to law enforcement

items.title: New Israeli Fiction | Six O'Clock After the War
items.summary: A short story by Masha Zur Glozman

items.title: 'Don't tell us it's a parking dispute': Jaffa on edge after attack on pregnant woman
items.summary: Arab residents say the incident reflects a broader pattern of persecution and violence. "We know what we're going through. Don't tell us this is a parking dispute," says a local activist

items.title: BBC captures celebrations as Belarus frees political prisoners
items.summary: Southern & Eastern Europe correspondent Sarah Rainsford reports from Lithuania, where some of the released prisoners were taken.

items.title: Russia’s Smuggled Grain Finds New Market in Saudi Arabia
items.summary: A joint investigation by Bellingcat and Lloyd’s List has identified Saudi Arabia as the newest country to import grain directly from a Western-sanctioned port in occupied Crimea, as Russia attempts to secure recognition of the Ukrainian territory via a US-led peace plan. items.title: From School to Battlefield to Grave: How Russian Cossacks drive young people to war
items.summary:
The All-Russian Cossack Society turns school clubs into pipelines for state-sponsored militarisation and recruitment for war in Ukraine. Bellingcat shows how they shape an alternative mobilisation force.

items.title: Mali Under Siege: Tracking the Fuel Blockade Crippling Bamako
items.summary: Attacks by a jihadist group on fuel convoys bound for Bamako, the capital of Mali, have destroyed more than 130 tankers since September, a Bellingcat investigation has found.  The systematic attacks by Jama’at Nusrat al-Islam wal-Muslimin (JNIM) have brought Bamako and other regions of the West

items.title: Building on Ruins: The Russification of Mariupol, One Apartment Block at a Time
items.summary: × “They Are Building Houses on Bones” It’s the second time Moreva has lost her home. She fled to Mariupol from Makiivka, an industrial city near Donetsk, after Russia occupied Donbas in 2014. The 57-year-old rebuilt her life in the port city, working as a professor in Mariupol State University’s eco

items.summary: Warning: Contains written descriptions of extreme violence including murder. All graphic footage has been omitted.
